newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds mixed, slow start to week.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds mixed, slow start to week.

text.p: Argentine bonds were mixed early Monday with Brady bonds following U.S. Treasuries lower and local bonds higher amid thin activity.
"The local market is very strong but very calm," said a trader at a local bank.
The trader added that considering the sustained firmness of the market in recent weeks it looked likely there will be no large correction before the end of the year.
The dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 rose 0.40 to 121.75, while Argentina's FRB due 2005 slipped 1/8 to 86-1/4.
Analysts at Banco Rio said in an investor note that "we believe only a very strong correction of the U.S. bond market could shift the upside trend of the local market."
In that sense, the maintenance of low U.S. bond yields will continue to give ample support to the Argentine market.

This week's release of the important U.S. employment report for the month of November on Friday will be key for the continuation of firm U.S. Treasuries and, thereby, the Argentine market, traders said.
